reviewText: As someone who has studied the history of Alchemy, despite the fact that it took about 90 minutes to get to the first mention of the artifact by name - it was so satisfying hearing the stone called by it's appropriate name, instead of being "dumbed down" for the "sake of the children in my country."  Very much worth it, in my book.
Don't really see what the difference is except they call it the Philosopher's Stone in the movie. Daughter really wanted it with the British title so it made a great Christmas surprise.
The only difference between this and the "Sorcerer's Stone" is the name of the stone in the film.  There is a second disc with some additional information.
So happy to have what was originally intended. Perfect
The only difference I saw was that the characters call it the philosophers stone.
If you're a true Harry Potter fan, you need this in your collection. It actually has scenes not in the US released edition.
